means: 山魈（西非洲产的大狒狒）

sentence.Network_en: A baboon ( Papio leucophaeus ) of western Africa, related to and resembling the mandrill.
sentence.Network_cn: 一种西非产 ( 鬼狒狒狒属 ), 与典型山魈有关并与其类似.

sentence.Network_en: Old World monkeys: guenon; baboon; colobus monkey; langur; macaque ; mandrill ; mangabey; patas; proboscis monkey.
sentence.Network_cn: 旧域猴; 长尾猴; 狒狒; 疣猴; 叶猴; 短尾猴; 山魈;白眉猴; 长鼻猴.

sentence.Network_en: Just think of the red stripes scowling face of the male Mandrill, Africa's largest monkey species.
sentence.Network_cn: 只要想想雄性大狒狒愁眉不展的面孔上的红色条纹就很理解吧, 可是非洲最大的猿类动物.

means.word_mean: 1. baboon of west Africa with red and blue muzzle and hindquarters

auth_sentence.content: The five species are some of the largest nonhominoid members of the primate order; only the mandrill and the drill are larger.

auth_sentence.content: They can also contribute to a wider body of scientific knowledge, as this mandrill study has shown.

auth_sentence.content: In the footage that Dr Pansini captured, a large male mandrill strips down a twig, apparently to make it narrower.
